contentrichtext.text: '''Joachim Aberlin''' (d. after 1554) was a [[Germany|German]] pastor, teacher and songwriter and is author of a large number of songs for the [[Reformed Church]]. He wrote the [[hymn]]al ''Der gantz Psalter'' (''The whole Psaltery'') in 1537, and 68 songs for the [[psalter]] of [[Sigmund Salminger]] in 1538. According to an [[acrostic]] in one of his larger poems (''Bibel oder heilige Geschrift: Gesangsweis in drei Liedern aufs kürzeste zusammenverfasset. Zürich bey Froschouer''). he was born in the village of [[Garmenschwiler]] between the [[Danube]] and the [[Bodensee]]. ==Sources== * {{Allgemeine Deutsche Biographie|1|20|20|Aberlin, Joachim|Paul Pressel|ADB:Aberlin, Joachim}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Aberlin, Joachim | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German pastor, teacher, songwriter and author | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aberlin, Joachim}} [[Category:16th-century deaths]] [[Category:German songwriters]] [[Category:Year of birth unknown]] {{Germany-writer-stub}}
